incoming.deadline: One month prior to the first day of term (e.g. August 1 for Fall Term; December 1 for Winter Term)
instructions: For detailed instructions for students at another university wishing to participate in a UAlberta course through the WDA, please see this page. The following information reflects practical experience of recent PIMS Network Wide Courses students.

Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures, then submit the form to relevant UAlberta department.  By signing the WDA form, the student's home department is providing written assurance that the course(s) listed on the form: (a) is not available at the home university; (b) is required for the student's program; and (c) will be credited toward the student's graduate degree program upon successful completion.

For courses taken at the University of Alberta, students will be assessed only Non-Instructional fees by the University of Alberta. If a course requires additional expenses under University of Alberta policy, the department will require that the student pay these. See the UAlberta Tuition + Fees page for current fees and details. Students are strongly encouraged to investigate possible exemption procedures with the contacts listed above, well in advance of the registration deadline.

The notes on this page discuss exemption criteria for GSA Health/Dental fees, and uPass fees. Please note the deadlines vary, and may be very early.
  • GSA Fee details
  • uPass details including exemption criteria and processes.

outgoing.deadline: One month prior to the first day of term (e.g. August 1 for Fall Term; December 1 for Winter Term)
instructions: For detailed instructions for students at UAlberta wishing to participate in a WDA course at another university, please see this page. The information below reflects practical experience of recent PIMS Network Wide Courses students.

Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures then submit it to host department. By approving the WDA application, the department at the University of Alberta is certifying that the course(s) listed on the form: (a) is not available at the University of Alberta; (b) is required for the student's program; and (c) will be credited to the student's graduate degree program upon successful completion with a satisfactory grade.

For each term of study under the WDA, the student will register at the University of Alberta in an Exchange (EXCH) course, which will be equivalent to the course weight registration at the university where the student is taking the course(s). The student will be assessed fees for that EXCH course at the University of Alberta. In accordance with the provisions of the WDA the student will be assessed general student fees, but no regular instructional fees by the university where the course(s) are being taken. If a course requires additional expenses, the university may require the student to pay these additional expenses.

incoming.deadline: Officially 6 weeks prior to the start of term - in recent experience - Friday before the term starts
instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to UBC department.  Once approved, the student gets an acceptance email which includes information on how to opt-out of some of the student fees.

The fee schedule can be found here. The total student fee is around $400. Any student can opt-out of the U-Pass, (about $200 - students from SFU are automatically opted out because they get a U-Pass from SFU). Any student can opt out of medical insurance (iMed, about $100) but must state that they have other medical insurance (domestic students are automatically opted-out because it is assumed they have medical insurance from their home institution). This leaves a residual of about $100 which the student pays.

See this page for fee exemption details, specifically
  • iMED Fee: See iMed - opting out, processing times 2-8 weeks
  • uPass: See UBC uPass, deadline is typically early July

Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to host department.  Students pay potential ancillary fees at the host institution.  Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.

incoming.deadline: Two weeks before the start of term.

contacts.name: Laura Bissel (Associate Director, Admissions and Records)

instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures. Submit form to the UBC Okanagan department. Once approved, the student gets an acceptance email which includes information on how to opt-out of some of the student fees.

Please Note: Applications to UBC-Okanagan are sometimes misdirected to UBC-Vancouver. Please be careful that your application is sent to UBC-Okanagan. We recommend following up with the College of Graduate Studies (address above) one or two weeks after submitting your paperwork to ensure it is on track.

Fee details can be found on this page. Some additional information on opting out of fees can be found here. You may be eligible for exemption for the uPass and iMed fees, leaving a residual of about $100 which the student pays. The Student is responsible for ordering an official transcript from UBC and have it sent to their home institution.

See Refunds and Opting out of Student Fees for more details, as well as
  • uPass: Opt-out criteria & deadlines
  • iMed: iMed - opting out, processing times 2-8 weeks

contacts.name: Laura Bissel (Associate Director, Admissions and Records)

instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to host department.  Students pay potential ancillary fees at the host institution.  Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.

Please Note: Applications to UBC-Okanagan are sometimes misdirected to UBC-Vancouver. Please be careful that your application is sent to UBC-Okanagan. We recommend following up with the College of Graduate Studies (address above) one or two weeks after submitting your paperwork to ensure it is on track.

incoming.deadline: 2 weeks before the start of the course
instructions: Please see this page for up to date information. The following reflects pratical experience from students participating in the PIMS Network Wide Courses program.
The student pays tuition and general fees at their home university and applicable general fees at UCalgary. General Fees at UCalgary may be found on this page.

Visiting and exchange students, including students joining through a Western Deans' agreement, will be assessed the Campus Recreation, Student Services, and Group Insurance fees, according to their full-time/part-time status in the terms in which they are registered.
The student is responsible for arranging for an official transcript to be sent from the host institution to the home institution when the course(s) has been completed.

outgoing.deadline: 2 weeks before the start of the course
instructions: Please see this page for up to date information. The following reflects pratical experience from students participating in the PIMS Network Wide Courses program.
Applications should be received in the Faculty of Graduate Studies at the host institution three months before the beginning of the term at the University of Calgary.
The student pays tuition and general fees at the home university and applicable general fees at the host institution.
The student is responsible for arranging for an official transcript to be sent from the host institution to the home institution when the course(s) has been completed.

incoming.deadline: 4 weeks prior to the first class
instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to UL department.   Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.There are no ancillary fees.

outgoing.deadline: 4 weeks prior to the first class
instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to host department.  Students pay potential ancillary fees at the host institution.  Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.

incoming.deadline: 4 weeks before the start of the course
instructions: Please see the UManitoba Program page and the UManitoba WDA FQA for up to date details. Fee information may be found on the General Graduate studies fees section of the Graduate Fees page (exemptions may apply). The following information reflects practical experience from PIMS Network Wide Graduate Course students.
1.  Fill out the WDA form
2.  Have your department fill out Part 1 under Home Institution.
3.  Submit the form, along with a course description of the course you wish to take, to the UManitoba Faculty of Graduate Studies.

outgoing.deadline: 4 weeks before the start of the course
instructions: Please see the UManitoba Program page and the UManitoba WDA FQA for up to date details. The following information reflects practical experience from PIMS Network Wide Graduate Course students.
1. Fill out the WDA form
2. Have your department fill out Part 1 under Home Institution.
3. Submit the form, along with a course description of the course you wish to take, to the UManitoba Faculty of Graduate Studies.
4. The Faculty of Graduate Studies will contact the Host Institution for their approval.

5. When the approval has been granted by the Host Institution, you will receive a Letter of Permission from the Registrar's Office at University of Manitoba.  You should also ensure that you have received an admission letter from the Host Institution and you are responsible for ensuring you are registered for the course at the Host Institution.  Students pay ancillary fees at the host institution (exemptions may apply).

6.  When the course has been completed and a grade assigned, please arrange to have an official transcript of marks from the Host Institution sent directly to the Registrar's Office, 400 University Centre, University of Manitoba.

incoming.deadline: 6 weeks prior to the start of term.

contacts.name: Faculty of Graduate Studies and Research

instructions:
All fee schedules can be found on this page. Non-instructional fees include:
  • Student's Union UPASS Fee
  • Student Service & Wellness Fee
  • Student's Union Fees
  • Academic Technologies Fee

Amounts and exemption conditions are listed on the same fee schedule page. In particular, Student Service & Wellness fee may be exempted upon proof of equivalent coverage, and the UPASS fee is typically not assessed if no on campus courses are being taken. See the fee schedule for details and details, and contact the Faculty of Graduate Studies and Research (above) with any questions.

contacts.name: Faculty of Graduate Studies and Research

instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to host department.  Students pay potential ancillary fees at the host institution.  Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.

incoming.deadline: As early as possible, however, every effort will be made to accommodate completed requests submitted to CGPS at least two weeks prior to the start of term.

contacts.name: College of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies

instructions: Students are advised to submit their applications at least two weeks prior to the start of term, and encouraged to do so as soon as possible. Inbound WDA students are assessed USask fees based on the number of credits they register in. A full list of student fees is available on this page (select 'Off-Campus, audit or Distance Education'), along with details about possible opt-out exemptions (see 'Fee adjustments' on the same page). In previous years, For Math/Stats the Distance Education fees are around $60. Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.

outgoing.deadline: As early as possible, however, every effort will be made to accommodate completed requests submitted to CGPS at least two weeks prior to the start of term.

contacts.name: College of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies

instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to host department.  Students pay potential ancillary fees at the host institution.  Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.

incoming.deadline: 6 weeks prior to start of the course
instructions: Complete application form and obtain home institution approvals. Submit form to Mathematics Graduate Program Assistant who will forward it to department graduate chair and then graduate studies. Students need to pay ancillary fees to SFU (around $80 in previous years). See the Academic Calendar for details. Once accepted, student will get a student number from SFU. Student is responsible for ordering an official transcript from SFU and have it sent to their home institution.

outgoing.deadline: 6 weeks prior to start of the course
instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures.  Submit form to host department.  Students pay potential ancillary fees at the host institution.  Students are responsible to request an official transcript from the host institution.

incoming.deadline: 6 weeks prior to start of the course
instructions: UVic provides explicit WDA registration instructions. Please see that page for up to date information.
Complete the WDA application, obtaining all 4 signatures. The form should be sent to UVic by the applicant's home department.
Apply via UVic's Online Application System, selecting the option for 'Western Dean's Agreement (WDA)'
If your application is accepted, we will register you in the approved course(s). You can request a transcript from the Office of the Registrar after you complete your stay at UVic.

Pay any applicable non-instructional fees. In recent experience typical fees are around $80 after all applicable exemptions have been secured. Some information on fee exemptions may be found on the 'Other Fee's tab of this page..

outgoing.deadline: 6 weeks prior to start of the course
instructions: Students must complete a WDA authorization and course registration form, specifying the host institution, the exact courses and their unit values.

The form must be supported with the signature from the supervisor of their committee. The form must then be returned to Graduate Admissions and Records (GARO) for the Director’s approval along with a course syllabus and information indicating the grading of the course.
If approval is given, the form will be sent directly to the host institution for their approvals.
Contact the potential host institution for details as soon as you receive verbal approval from your supervisor.  Students pay potential ancillary fees.
Complete the Graduate program update form
Obtain a copy of the course syllabus either from this site, or from the course instructor (UVic will request this information as part of the process)
Student will arrange for official transcripts from the host institution confirming successful completion of course.
Student must send confirmation of registration and notice of any change to the Graduate Records Office of the home institution at the time of registration or course change is completed.
